GPS L1C/A Codes Generator¬∂

Introduction üìã¬∂

GPS L1C/A (Coarse/Acquisition) are sequences of zeroes and ones used in GPS communications, being P-Code other type of code GPS uses.

They are also known by PRN codes (Pseudorandom Noise), but in reality they are generated using an algorithm, which is freely available, and that‚Äôs the main goal of this repo.

Inside this repo is an implementation of the C/A Algorithm developed in Python, so anyone could generate codes with customized polynomials and sequences of n desired bits.

GPS Signals

Features ‚ú®¬∂

  • Customized inputs.

  • Collection of satellites taps by prn code.

Install üîß¬∂

git clone https://github.com/iluzioDev/gpsl1ca
cd gpsl1ca
python3 gpsl1ca

Usage üí°¬∂

Once executed, a menu will prompt asking for desired option:

‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†
‚ñ†          WELCOME TO THE GPS L1C/A CODE GENERATOR!               ‚ñ†
‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†
What would you want to do?
[1] Generate GPS L1C/A Code.
[2] Check G2 Taps by prn id.
[0] Exit.
‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†
Option  ->

  1. Asks for a prn id and number of bits to generate. Once inputs are introduced, it will generate a code of n bits each one result of the algorithm operations. In the end, a table will be prompted with all steps made and the resulting code.

  2. Shows the collection of taps by prn id.

API¬∂

gpsl1ca.LFSR(sequence, polynomial)¬∂

Makes a Linear Feedback Shift Register (LFSR) operation in a given sequence.

Args:

sequence (str): Sequence to be shifted. polynomial (str): Primative polynomial to be used in the operation.

Returns:

str | None: Shifted sequence in success, None in failure.

gpsl1ca.GPS_L1CA_generator(prn_id, n)¬∂

Generates a GPS L1C/A code using a specific prn id and a given number of bits to generate.

Args:

prn_id (int): Pseudo-random noise id of satellite. n (int): Number of bits to generate.

Returns:

str | None: Generated code in success, None in failure.

gpsl1ca.main()¬∂

Main function of the program. Users can choose between generating a GPS L1C/A code or checking G2 taps by prn id.
